result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Thomas E Podolske. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for plea hearing. 

Upon a plea to count #2, the State would move to strike the repeater enhancer. 

Defendant enters a no-contest plea to count #2. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds the Defendant guilty of count #2, with the repeater enhancer struck. Count #1 and Count #2 are dismissed and read-in.

Parties request a PSI. Court orders.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 07/25/2022:
Court authorizes the Defendant non-violent contact with Victim A listed in Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, ONLY by phone or by video, from the Jail while in custody. If bond is posted and the Defendant is released, no in-person contact will be allowed.  All other conditions remain. 

CONDTIONS MODIFIED 05/11/2022:  The Court authorizes the defendant to have telephone contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key but further orders the Defendant is not to discuss the case with Victim A.  All other conditions remain.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Best Western Hotel/Victim A (with the exception of telephone contact with Victim A as amended on 05/11/2022)/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to pay costs associated with GPS monitoring.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

Court will modify bond to authorize non-violent contact with Victim A listed in Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, ONLY by phone or by video, from the Jail while in custody. 08:32 AM Defendant Thomas E Podolske in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Attorney Kershek states he spoke with the assigned ADA that he would be requesting to address bail conditions today.  State has no objection so long as Victim A is present and can make a statement.  Victim A and Victim Witness Specialist appear by zoom.  Attorney Kershek requests the defendant be allowed to have phone contact with Victim A and presents arguments.  Victim A presents statements and would like phone contact with the defendant.  State does not take a position.  The Court will grant the request for telephone contact with Victim A but the defendant is not to discuss the case with Victim A.  All other conditions remain and the monetary amount of bail remains as fixed.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
